ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Mild to moderate SNHL, stable over a decade, associated with history of noise exposure and aging.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Exostoses
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral bony growths in ear canals identified on otoscopy; history of cold water swimming.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Age-related auditory processing decline
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Evidenced by declining speech-in-noise scores (SNR loss) despite stable pure-tone thresholds.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Visual inspection of ear canals to identify exostoses.
Assess word recognition abilities in quiet.
Monitor stability of hearing thresholds at follow-up.
Monitor aided performance and processing abilities.
Track improvements in cognitive skills from training program.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation revealed bilateral symmetrical mild to moderate sensorineural hearing loss and bilateral exostoses (Right > Left). Middle ear function and retrocochlear screening were normal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilaterally symmetrical mild to moderate sensorineural hearing loss.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word recognition testing in quiet was within normal limits.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up showed stable hearing loss. Patient expressed interest in 'less noticeable' amplification after previously deferring treatment.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Hearing loss found to be stable.

tests.name: Hearing aid fitting
tests.result_summary: Fit with left CIC hearing aid; right ear fitting prevented by exostoses.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Patient using left CIC hearing aid; right ear fit prevented by exostoses. Speech-in-noise testing was normal.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN performance within normal limits (~2 dB SNR loss).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Hearing thresholds remained stable, but speech-in-noise ability declined to mild-to-moderate SNR loss. Exostoses appeared smaller. Patient started brain training.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN score decreased to mild-to-moderate SNR loss (5.5 dB SNR loss at 65 dB HL).

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Exostoses appeared to have decreased in size bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word recognition scores in quiet remained within normal limits.

tests.name: Hearing aid fitting
tests.result_summary: Fit with bilateral open-fit mini-BTE hearing aids.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Monitoring progress with bilateral open-fit mini-BTEs and brain training. SNR loss stabilized, and cognitive training showed improvements in memory and discrimination.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Fairly stable SNR loss (4.5 dB SNR loss at 55 dB HL).

tests.name: Brain Training Performance
tests.result_summary: Improvement in sound discrimination (14%), auditory memory (4%), and long-term memory (24%) over 4 years.

proposed_items: Remote microphone paired with hearing aids
counseling_actions: Discussed the effects of long-term untreated hearing loss on auditory processing and cognition.
Counseled on the benefits of binaural amplification versus cosmetic preferences.
Explained the nature of exostoses and their impact on custom hearing aid fitting.
Encouraged consistent brain training to improve processing speed and memory.

escalation.destination: Audiological monitoring and continued brain training
escalation.rationale_short: Condition is managed with amplification and training; no medical red flags requiring referral.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds, speech-in-noise ability, and cognitive training progress.

expected_outcome: Fit with new open-fit mini-BTE hearing aids paired wirelessly with a remote microphone to enhance speech in noise and TV listening.
Patient reports performing better on brain training exercises and hearing subtleties in speech and conversations previously missed.
